Package io.avery.vinyl

Class JoinAPI

java.lang.Object
io.avery.vinyl.JoinAPI
public class JoinAPI extends Object
A configurator used to define a relational join operation between a left and a right record-stream.

A join operation streams the left-side, and for each left-side record, searches the right-side for matching records such that the (left, right) pair of records satisfy a configured join condition. When a match is found, a resulting record is created as configured and emitted downstream. The returned stream will have a new header, shared by the new records.

The configurator consists of two sub-configurators: a JoinAPI.On that defines the join condition, and a JoinAPI.Select that defines the output fields.

See Also:
  • RecordStream.join(io.avery.vinyl.RecordStream, java.util.function.Function<io.avery.vinyl.JoinAPI.On, io.avery.vinyl.JoinPred>, java.util.function.Consumer<io.avery.vinyl.JoinAPI.Select>)
  • RecordStream.leftJoin(io.avery.vinyl.RecordStream, java.util.function.Function<io.avery.vinyl.JoinAPI.On, io.avery.vinyl.JoinPred>, java.util.function.Consumer<io.avery.vinyl.JoinAPI.Select>)
  • RecordStream.rightJoin(io.avery.vinyl.RecordStream, java.util.function.Function<io.avery.vinyl.JoinAPI.On, io.avery.vinyl.JoinPred>, java.util.function.Consumer<io.avery.vinyl.JoinAPI.Select>)
  • RecordStream.fullJoin(io.avery.vinyl.RecordStream, java.util.function.Function<io.avery.vinyl.JoinAPI.On, io.avery.vinyl.JoinPred>, java.util.function.Consumer<io.avery.vinyl.JoinAPI.Select>)
